markdown.markdown: ## Research questions {auto-animate="true"} **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape Visiting migration?** ## Research questions {auto-animate="true"} **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [Visiting migration]{style="color: blue;"}?** ## Research questions {auto-animate="true"} **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [Visiting migration]{style="color: blue;"}?** **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [transnational migration]{style="color: blue;"}?** ## Research questions {auto-animate="true"} **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [Visiting migration]{style="color: blue;"}?** **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [transnational migration]{style="color: blue;"}?** **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape [home visiting]{style="color: blue;"}?** ## Definition: - **Visiting migration**: visiting the country of origin. - **Multiple migration**: repeated, secondary, onward, stepwise and serial migration [@steiner_who_2019] - **Transnationalism**: becoming firmly rooted in their new country but maintaining simultaneously multiple linkages to their homeland [@steiner_how_2019]. ## Example: Visiting migration (visiting) {auto-animate="true"} ![](image/swiss_spain.png){.absolute top="200"} ## Example: Visiting migration (visiting) {auto-animate="true"} ![](image/swiss_spain.png){.absolute top="200"} ![](image/arrow_left.png){.absolute right="470" top="350"} ## Example: Visiting migration (visiting) {auto-animate="true"} ![](image/swiss_spain.png){.absolute top="200"} ![](image/arrow_left.png){.absolute right="470" top="350"} ![](image/arrow_right.png){.absolute right="470" top="450"} ## Example: Visiting migration (visiting) {auto-animate="true"} ![](image/swiss_spain.png){.absolute top="200"} ![](image/arrow_left.png){.absolute right="470" top="350"} ![](image/arrow_right.png){.absolute right="470" top="450"} ![](image/virus.png){.absolute right="360"} # What is the expected impact? ## Impact of Covid-19 travel restriction {auto-animate="true"} - Exceptions based on previous ties [@piccoli_regulating_2025] - **H:** Center-Periphery ![](image/Sequence_plot_distribution.png) ## Impact of Covid-19 travel restriction {auto-animate="true"} ![](image/Sequence_plot_distribution.png) ## Impact of Covid-19 travel restriction {auto-animate="true"} - **Cross-border mobility virtually impossible [@jarv_impact_2021]** - After border reopeing: Increase of transnational ties with the country of origin - **Reduced life satisfaction among migrants [@gerber_life_2022]** - But transnational ties reduced this effect ## Impact of Covid-19 travel restriction {auto-animate="true"} ::: nonincremental - **Cross-border mobility virtually impossible [@jarv_impact_2021]** - After border reopeing: Increase of transnational ties with the country of origin - **Reduced life satisfaction among migrants [@gerber_life_2022]** - But transnational ties reduced this effect ::: **Expected: overall [decrease]{style="color: red;"} in Visiting migration.** ## Impact of Covid-19 travel restriction {auto-animate="true"} ::: nonincremental - **Cross-border mobility virtually impossible [@jarv_impact_2021]** - After border reopeing: Increase of transnational ties with the country of origin - **Reduced life satisfaction among migrants [@gerber_life_2022]** - But transnational ties reduced this effect **Expected: overall [decrease]{style="color: red;"} in transnational mobility.** ::: **But transnationality [mitigate]{style="color: blue;"} this effect** # Did the COVID-19 reduce Visiting migration in Switzerland? ## Switzerland ![](image/mms%20covid%20where%20majority%20stay.png) ## Switzerland ![](image/mms%20covid%20plan%20to%20stay%20in%20ch.png) ## Visit to coutnry of origin (DV) ::: {#viz1763410008919 .tableauPlaceholder style="position: relative"} ``` ::: ```{=html} ``` # Literature Review ## Migration vs mobility {auto-animate="true"} **Previously** - **Migration**: Unique long-term move - **Mobility**: Multiple short-term move ## Migration vs mobility {auto-animate="true"} **Previously** ::: nonincremental - **Migration**: Unique long-term move - Undesirable - **Mobility**: Multiple short-term move - Acceptable ::: ## Migration vs mobility {auto-animate="true"} **Today** - **Questioning this distinction:** - migration mobility nexus, anchoring, embedding, etc. - **Relation blurred** ## Migration vs mobility {auto-animate="true"} **Today** - **Migration Mobility Nexus**: Relationship between migration and mobility as: - **Enablement**: One enable the other - **Continuum**: There is a continuity between them - **Hierarchy**: One is deemed superior or preferable than the other - **Opposition**: One oppose the other ## Migration vs mobility {auto-animate="true"} - **Continuum**: The first migration is embedded in the circular mobility between the host country and the country of origin. - **Transnationalism**: Ties are maintained - Network: Family & Friends - Attachment - Belonging # Visiting migration ↔ Transnationalism in Switzerland ## Linking mobility patterns to transnational ties ![](image/chapter%2011.png) ## Core Concepts - **Transnationalism**: Simultaneous participation in: 1. **Transnational mobility**\ 2. **Transnational social networks**\ 3. **Transnational attachment** ## Findings 1. **Contradict** the idea that **the longer individual stay the less transnational** 2. **Transnationality is ressource-dependant**: legal capital (EU passport), education capital (Highly skilled) 3. **Reactive transnationalism** (triggered by marginalization and discrimination), **does not hold** for mobility. ## Five ideal types of *transmigrant* {.scrollable} ::: nonincremental 1. **Immobile, one‑time migrants** – low moves, high attachment (Southern EU, women). 2. **Former very‑mobile men, now settled** – high pre‑moves, low current mobility, low attachment (EU/US, high education). 3. **One‑time migrants now mobile & attached** – low pre‑moves, partner/children abroad, high attachment (women, Asia/LatAm). 4. **Cosmopolitan, hyper‑mobile, low attachment** – many moves, friends abroad, low attachment (US/UK, high education). 5. **Hyper‑mobile outsiders** – many moves, low attachment, low education (Western Balkans, low legal capital). ::: ## Why Visiting migration Matters - **Pre‑migration mobility** - 54 % moved **once‑twice**\ - 37 % moved **3‑5 times**\ - 7 % moved **\> 5 times** before arriving in Switzerland. - **Post‑migration mobility** - 65 % visit origin **≥ once / year**\ - 18 % visit **monthly** or more. - Shows **generalized mobility** beyond the “high‑skill‑expat” narrative. ## Key points 1. Visiting migration is a continuum 2. Recently arrived migrants are highly mobile 3. Need for a proper measure of transnationalism # **How did the COVID‑19 pandemic reshape Visiting migration?** ## Hypothesis **H1**: Covid-19 leads to a decrease in Visiting migration **H2**: Expecting an increase in Visiting migration in 2024 **H3**: A higher transnationality increase Visiting migration ## Methodology {.scrollable} **DV**: How often have you visited your country of origin? **IVs**: - COVID-19: years - transnational types (social & attachment)? - Socio-demographics - Controls ## Data **Migration Mobility Survey** - Panel with refresh sample - **Five waves**: 2016, 2018, 2020, 2022 and 2024 - Mean size: \~7'000 individuals **Sample**: With the years 2018, 2020 and 2022 - 2'117 individuals - Risk of further decrease if 2024 wave included ## Model **Mulilevel bayesian ordinal regression** - **Multilevel**: Longitudinal data - **Bayesian**: Risk of small dataset - **Ordinal**: Dependent variable # Questions ## Questions {auto-animate="true"} - Is the presentation understandable? - Which term should I use? (Visiting migration, transnational migration, home visiting) - Do the hypothesis make sens? - Does the chosen model make sens? - Any advice? ## Questions {auto-animate="true"} ::: nonincremental - Is the presentation understandable? - Which term should I use? (Visiting migration, transnational migration, home visiting) - Do the hypothesis make sens? - Does the chosen model make sens? - Any advice? ::: **Thank you for your attention!** ## References ::: {#refs} :::
